Name: Plaque with udjat-eye motif
Description: Rectangular steatite plaque with a detailed rendering of the udjat-eye in relief on one side, and incised motifs on the underside depicting a lion (?), baboon and sphinx. The udjat-eye served as a protective symbol of good health. The other images are less easy to explain, but may provide a hidden writing (cryptogram) of the name of a god such as Amun-Re, the creator.
